  2. Adding shops to delta (lol nothing is easier than this other then changing name)

  5. Its 2011 not 2007, atleast use a PI

item.title: Coding For Beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:396924”]I hate the ‘well this is for noobs so i can use bad practices’ excuse… if it’s for beginners you should do the OPPOSITE, make sure your code is perfect so they don’t learn the wrong way. I started learning Java from my first source (which was a very crappy base) and the time it took me to realize I was doing everything wrong set me way back[/quote]Same.

Read full topic

item.title: Coding For Beginners!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I hate the ‘well this is for noobs so i can use bad practices’ excuse… if it’s for beginners you should do the OPPOSITE, make sure your code is perfect so they don’t learn the wrong way. I started learning Java from my first source (which was a very crappy base) and the time it took me to realize I was doing everything wrong set me way back

Read full topic

item.title: Coding For Beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:396924”]so i herd u liek xtra code

public static void main(String[] args) {
        PrintStream _ = System.out;
        StringBuilder __ = new StringBuilder();
        byte[] ___ = ("You just lost the game.").getBytes();
        int ____ = 0;
        for (int _____ = 0; _____ < ___.length; _____ = _____ + 1) {
            ____ = ____ + 1;
        }
        for (int _____ = 0; _____ < ____; _____ = _____ + 1) {
            char ______ = (char) ___[_____];
            __.append(______);
        }
        String ______ = __.toString();
        _.print(______);
        _.print('\n');
        return;
    }

And yes, you can compile and run this code.[/quote]ftw!

Read full topic

item.title: Coding For Beginners!
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“no1toldme2, post:9, topic:396924”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=494082.msg3612219#msg3612219 date=1306687191]
1; what the…?

2;

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 0) { addSkillXP(14910000, 0); addSkillXP(14910000, 1); addSkillXP(14910000, 2); addSkillXP(14910000, 3); addSkillXP(14910000, 4); addSkillXP(14910000, 5); addSkillXP(14910000, 6); addSkillXP(14910000, 7); addSkillXP(14910000, 8); addSkillXP(14910000, 9); addSkillXP(14910000, 10); addSkillXP(14910000, 11); addSkillXP(14910000, 12); addSkillXP(14910000, 13); addSkillXP(14910000, 14); addSkillXP(14910000, 15); addSkillXP(14910000, 16); addSkillXP(14910000, 17); addSkillXP(14910000, 18); addSkillXP(14910000, 19); addSkillXP(14910000, 20); addSkillXP(14910000, 21); addSkillXP(14910000, 22); addSkillXP(14910000, 23); sendMessage("Master of everything"); }

Or just loop your master command?

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 0) { for (int i = 0; i < 21; i++) { addSkillXP(14000000, i); } }
It takes quite a bit less of code than what you used.

3; this is… pretty bad.
[/quote]
That master command works too…
Also This is for DUMMIES!/BEGINNERS that don’t know what there doing.[/quote]Look how much code you used compared to how much code I used, mine does the same exact thing yours does, but mine used about 12x less code then yours.

Read full topic
